ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python package¶

Submodules¶

ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_config module¶

class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_config.PythonJobConfig(job_name: Optional[str] = None, properties: Optional[Dict[str, ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig

PythonJobConfig is the configuration of the python job. It has a configuration item env, which represents the environment variables of the python job. Job config example:

job_name:

job_type: python properties:

python_executable_path: /usr/bin/python3 env:

a: a b: b

Parameters

  • job_name – Name of the configured job.

  • job_type – The job type of the job, such as bash python etc..

  • properties – Properties of the configured job.

property env¶

ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_plugin module¶

class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_plugin.PythonJob(job_config: ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.workflow.job.Job

PythonJob is the description of python type job. The run_graph_file field stores the serialized file of the RunGraph (ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_plugin.RunGraph).

Parameters

job_config – Job configuration information(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig).

class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_plugin.PythonJobController[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobController

cleanup_job(job_handle: ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobHandle, job_runtime_env: Optional[Any] = None)[source]¶

Clean up temporary resources created during this execution. :param job_runtime_env: The job runtime environment. Type: ai_flow.runtime.job_runtime_env.JobRuntimeEnv :param job_handle: The job handle that contains the necessary information for an execution.

get_job_status(job_handle: ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobHandle) → ai_flow.workflow.status.Status[source]¶

Return the job status.

get_result(job_handle: ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobHandle, blocking: bool = True) → object[source]¶

Return the job result. :param job_handle: The job handle that contains the necessary information for an execution. :param blocking: blocking is true: Wait for the job to finish and return the result of the job.

blocking is false: If the job is running, return None.

If the job is finish, return the result of job.

stop_job(job_handle: ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobHandle, job_runtime_env: Optional[Any] = None)[source]¶

Stop a ai flow job. :param job_runtime_env: The job runtime environment. Type: ai_flow.runtime.job_runtime_env.JobRuntimeEnv :param job_handle: The job handle that contains the necessary information for an execution.

submit_job(job: ai_flow.workflow.job.Job, job_runtime_env: Optional[ai_flow.runtime.job_runtime_env.JobRuntimeEnv] = None) → ai_flow.plugin_interface.job_plugin_interface.JobHandle[source]¶

Submit an executable job to run. :param job_runtime_env: The job runtime environment. Type: ai_flow.runtime.job_runtime_env.JobRuntimeEnv :param job: A job object that contains the necessary information for an execution. :return job_handle: a job handle that maintain the handler of a job runtime.

submit_python_process(bash_command: List, env, working_dir, stdout_log, stderr_log)[source]¶
class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_job_plugin.PythonJobGenerator[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.translator.translator.JobGenerator

generate(sub_graph: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AISubGraph, resource_dir: Optional[str] = None) → ai_flow.workflow.job.Job[source]¶

Convert AISubGraph(ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AISubGraph) to Job(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job) :param sub_graph: An executable Graph composed of AINode and data edges with the same job configuration. :param resource_dir: Store the executable files generated during the generation process. :return: Job(ai_flow.workflow.job.Job)

ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor module¶

class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor.ExecutionContext(job_execution_info: ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.JobExecutionInfo, config: Dict)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.util.json_utils.Jsonable

ExecutionContext contains job execution information(job_execution_info) and AINode node configuration parameters(config). ExecutionContext is passed as a parameter to the process function of PythonProcessor.

property config: Dict¶
Returns

The AINode node configuration parameters.

property job_execution_info: ai_flow.plugin_interface.scheduler_interface.JobExecutionInfo¶
Returns

The job execution information

property name¶
property node_type¶
class ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor.PythonProcessor[source]¶

Bases: object

PythonProcessor is the processor corresponding to the python job.

close(execution_context: ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor.ExecutionContext)[source]¶

Close method for user-defined function. It can be used as a cleanup phase after the process function.

abstract process(execution_context: ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor.ExecutionContext, input_list: List) → List[source]¶

Process method for user-defined function. User write their logic in this method. :param execution_context: The execution_context contains job execution information(job_execution_info) and AINode node configuration parameters(config). :param input_list: The input data list of the processor. :return The output of the processor.

setup(execution_context: ai_flow_plugins.job_plugins.python.python_processor.ExecutionContext)[source]¶

Setup method for user-defined function. It can be used as a preparation stage before the process function.
